newsitem.title: GEORGIA: Georgian police detain grenade-wielding fugitive.
newsitem.headline: Georgian police detain grenade-wielding fugitive.

text.p: Georgian police surrounded a building in central Tbilisi on Tuesday as a wanted man held a woman hostage for seven hours and threatened to throw grenades from a fifth-story balcony into a crowded market place below.
The siege ended when the fugitive, Gocha Koyava, shot himself in the stomach. Witnesses saw him taken away by ambulance, wrapped in an oriental rug.
Police said Koyava had been hunted since 1995 for theft. The hostage, a neighbour, was unhurt.
